column4: anyone know about grub error 18?
yes.. it's one of the most asked questions here.. sadly I can't remember any good answers to it..
well if ubuntu didn't crash about 3 times (literally) in a row for no reason this wouldn't have happened :P
hehe.. I think error 18 might be about grub not finding files or partitions it's supposed to boot from
no, the files are fine and there
then perhaps the disks have switched places for some reason? new partition somewhere?
no! it just crashed - 3 times - and then this happened
and all your drives are still working?
of course. i'm talking to you from windows.
well.. then it's the "pizza way".. buy your local linux-guru a pizza and say he can have it after he fixes your computer ;)
local linux guru? you overestimate this place :-)

if I were you I'd boot from a live cd and do the steps described in setting up grub.. ie set boot drive, grub setup etc etc.. it's a little bit like the old "reboot, reinstall"-solution but it's all I've got to offer
:/ i guess
here's a good page to read for suggestions.. http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic.php?t=122656&highlight=grub+error+collection
gosh, gentoo... any cflags twiddling in there before i click? ;)
no cflags.. just lots of grub errors (and lots of.. yes I know you *think* you did.. but did you really ?..) =)
think i did what i really what.
look further down.. it can also be about bios detecting disks in another order than grub
i'm 100% sure it's right
my guess is something broke in your boot process.. bios resetting something.. some grub files broken.. disks resetting.. something that made the system not finding the boot drives, boot files etc
